channel.title: Papers with Code: Trending (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: DreamBooth: Fine Tuning Text-to-Image Diffusion Models for Subject-Driven Generation
item.description: Once the subject is embedded in the output domain of the model, the unique identifier can then be used to synthesize fully-novel photorealistic images of the subject contextualized in different scenes.

item.title: CLIP-Mesh: Generating textured meshes from text using pretrained image-text models
item.description: We present a technique for zero-shot generation of a 3D model using only a target text prompt.

item.title: YOLOX-PAI: An Improved YOLOX, Stronger and Faster than YOLOv6
item.description: We develop an all-in-one computer vision toolbox named EasyCV to facilitate the use of various SOTA computer vision methods.

item.title: A Gentle Introduction to Conformal Prediction and Distribution-Free Uncertainty Quantification
item.description: Conformal prediction is a user-friendly paradigm for creating statistically rigorous uncertainty sets/intervals for the predictions of such models.

item.title: FedBN: Federated Learning on Non-IID Features via Local Batch Normalization
item.description: The emerging paradigm of federated learning (FL) strives to enable collaborative training of deep models on the network edge without centrally aggregating raw data and hence improving data privacy.

item.title: ProDiff: Progressive Fast Diffusion Model For High-Quality Text-to-Speech
item.description: Through the preliminary study on diffusion model parameterization, we find that previous gradient-based TTS models require hundreds or thousands of iterations to guarantee high sample quality, which poses a challenge for accelerating sampling.

item.title: Behavior Trees in Robotics and AI: An Introduction
item.description: A Behavior Tree (BT) is a way to structure the switching between different tasks in an autonomous agent, such as a robot or a virtual entity in a computer game.

item.title: Transformers are Sample Efficient World Models
item.description: Deep reinforcement learning agents are notoriously sample inefficient, which considerably limits their application to real-world problems.

item.title: Text-Free Learning of a Natural Language Interface for Pretrained Face Generators
item.description: We propose Fast text2StyleGAN, a natural language interface that adapts pre-trained GANs for text-guided human face synthesis.

item.title: LibMTL: A Python Library for Multi-Task Learning
item.description: This paper presents LibMTL, an open-source Python library built on PyTorch, which provides a unified, comprehensive, reproducible, and extensible implementation framework for Multi-Task Learning (MTL).

item.title: An Image is Worth One Word: Personalizing Text-to-Image Generation using Textual Inversion
item.description: Yet, it is unclear how such freedom can be exercised to generate images of specific unique concepts, modify their appearance, or compose them in new roles and novel scenes.

item.title: Large-Scale Intelligent Microservices
item.description: Deploying Machine Learning (ML) algorithms within databases is a challenge due to the varied computational footprints of modern ML algorithms and the myriad of database technologies each with its own restrictive syntax.

item.title: Text-Guided Synthesis of Artistic Images with Retrieval-Augmented Diffusion Models
item.description: In RDMs, a set of nearest neighbors is retrieved from an external database during training for each training instance, and the diffusion model is conditioned on these informative samples.

item.title: Adan: Adaptive Nesterov Momentum Algorithm for Faster Optimizing Deep Models
item.description: Then Adan adopts NME to estimate the first- and second-order moments of the gradient in adaptive gradient algorithms for convergence acceleration.

item.title: Feature Selection Methods for Uplift Modeling and Heterogeneous Treatment Effect
item.description: Uplift modeling is a causal learning technique that estimates subgroup-level treatment effects.

item.title: YourTTS: Towards Zero-Shot Multi-Speaker TTS and Zero-Shot Voice Conversion for everyone
item.description: YourTTS brings the power of a multilingual approach to the task of zero-shot multi-speaker TTS.

item.title: FedDM: Iterative Distribution Matching for Communication-Efficient Federated Learning
item.description: Federated learning~(FL) has recently attracted increasing attention from academia and industry, with the ultimate goal of achieving collaborative training under privacy and communication constraints.

item.title: Federated Learning via Decentralized Dataset Distillation in Resource-Constrained Edge Environments
item.description: We introduce a novel federated learning framework, FedD3, which reduces the overall communication volume and with that opens up the concept of federated learning to more application scenarios in network-constrained environments.

item.title: Attention Is All You Need
item.description: The dominant sequence transduction models are based on complex recurrent or convolutional neural networks in an encoder-decoder configuration.

item.title: FocusNet: Classifying Better by Focusing on Confusing Classes
item.description: We also introduce a novel focus-picking loss function to improve classification accuracy by encouraging FocusNet to focus on the most confusing classes.
